intro: Oubanguia thollonii, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is native to tropical Africa. It is a small, deciduous tree that can grow up to 10 meters tall, characterized by its smooth, gray bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is known for its latex sap, which is milky and can be toxic. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and traditional contexts across its native range.
